oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Flat Bushmen' make a needle for sewing from the foreleg bone of a springbok; what the bone (|kao) and the needle (=oro) are called. The bones of all things are each named. 1) This story is found in Book V-10.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The making of a needle from a springbok's foreleg
